pickerTitle: Haags Historisch Museum - Verlangen naar Vrijheid en Vrede
name: Verlangen naar Vrijheid en Vrede
metaDescription: Wat doet een oorlog met mensen? Daarover gaat Verlangen naar Vrijheid en Vrede in het Haags Historisch Museum.
description: Wat doet een oorlog met mensen? Daarover gaat Verlangen naar Vrijheid en Vrede in het Haags Historisch Museum.
descriptionReadMore:
### Ooggetuigen van de oorlog
Koningin Wilhelmina, George Maduro, Anton Mussert en Erik Hazelhoff Roelfzema werden bekend door de rol die ze speelden in de Tweede Wereldoorlog. In de tentoonstelling *Verlangen naar Vrijheid en Vrede* komen ook minder bekende ooggetuigen van de oorlog aan het woord. Zoals het Joodse meisje Edith van Hessen, dat net als Anne Frank een dagboek bijhield. En Reinder Zwolsman, actief in de zwarthandel én in het verzet.

### Wat doet oorlog met mensen? 
Deze vraag staat centraal in de tentoonstelling. Ooggetuigen vertellen over de angstige meidagen van 1940, het Duitse bestuur, de razzia’s, de Jodenvervolging, de Atlantikwall, het afvuren van V-2’s, de bombardementen en de Hongerwinter. De bijzondere verhalen -aangevuld met foto’s, film en objecten- maken van de tentoonstelling een indrukwekkende ervaring.

pickerTitle: De Koperen Knop - Een spannend detectivespel, speurtocht en knutselen
name: Een spannend detectivespel, speurtocht en knutselen
metaDescription: Bij de expositie in Museum De Koperen Knop zijn allerlei leuke activiteiten voor kinderen: een spannend detectivespel, speurtocht én knutselen.
description: Bij de tentoonstelling 'Spannende Troep’ in Museum De Koperen Knop zijn allerlei leuke kinderactiviteiten. Wat dacht je van een spannend detectivespel of een speurtocht?
descriptionReadMore:
### Leuke activiteiten voor kinderen
Oud en jong zullen versteld staan van de mogelijkheden om de afvalberg tegen te gaan. Met tips voor de volwassenen en heel veel leuke doe activiteiten voor de kids. 

Voor de kids is er een spannend detectivespel (waarbij de ouders en grootouders mogen helpen) en een leuke speurtocht. Heb je de speurtocht gemaakt, lever hem dan in bij de balie en ontvang een verrassing. Na de expositie worden er 5 prijswinnaars uitgeloot. Ook is er een knutselmogelijkheid in een grote eigen tent en voor de kleinsten zijn er kleurplaten.

Kom jij ook?

pickerTitle: Mauritshuis - George Stubbs - The man, the horse, the obsession
name: George Stubbs - The man, the horse, the obsession
metaDescription: This spring, Mauritshuis presents an exhibition about England’s most celebrated horse painter George Stubbs.
description: This spring, Mauritshuis presents an exhibition about England’s most celebrated horse painter George Stubbs. Extraordinary highlight of the exhibition is the enormous portrait of the racehorse Whistlejacket.
descriptionReadMore:
### Skeleton of Eclipse
This is the first time that this masterpiece from The National Gallery in London has travelled to mainland Europe. The exhibition also shows the skeleton of Eclipse, the most famous racehorse of all time, and the portrait of Eclipse painted by Stubbs.

### Leading horse painter
In the exhibition we’re focussing on a significant period in Stubbs’ career: the 1750s and 1760s. His acquaintance with the portrait painter Joshua Reynolds had put him in touch with eminent patrons. During this period, Stubbs quickly developed to become the leading horse painter in his country. The horse was a status symbol and wealthy owners wanted portraits of their swiftest and finest animals on their walls.

pickerTitle: Rijksmuseum van Oudheden - Romans along the Rhine
name: Romans along the Rhine
metaDescription: In the exhibition Romans along the Rhine, you can find out how people lived along the banks of the Rhine in the Netherlands 2,000 years ago.
description: In the family exhibition Romans along the Rhine, visitors of all ages can find out how people lived along the banks of the Rhine in the Netherlands 2,000 years ago. At the time, the river marked the limes, the northern boundary of the Roman Empire.
descriptionReadMore:
If you thought that this region was inhabited only by soldiers in fortresses, you would be quite wrong. The villages that lay along the border, and even the fortresses, were full of the soldiers’ families: women, children and servants.

### What can you see?
In Romans along the Rhine you can see, do and discover a wealth of fascinating things about everyday life along the banks of the Roman territory. Important parts of this are the 300 archaeological finds from fortresses and surrounding villages. You will see swords, helmets and leather sandals, but also wooden toys, tumblers into which soldiers once scratched their names, the bronze certificate of a soldier, ladies’ jewellery, and babies’ feeding bottles. One remarkable exhibit is the altar of a Roman governor who was born on the southern frontier of the Roman Empire, in Algeria. After having fought in every corner of the empire, he eventually ended up in Vechten, in what is today the province of Utrecht.

pickerTitle: Nationaal Militair Museum - Him or me
name: Him or me
metaDescription: A bitter battle was fought for the liberation of Europe 75 years ago. With the exhibition 'Him or me' the NMM is focusing on this battle in 2020.
description: A bitter battle was fought for the liberation of Europe 75 years ago. With the exhibition 'Hij of ik' (Him or me) the NMM is focusing on this battle in 2020.
descriptionReadMore:
Through the eyes of Léo, a Canadian, and Hans, a German, you experience the liberation of the Netherlands in the exhibition from a personal perspective.

### Objects
We are pulling out all the stops for '75 years of liberation'. In addition to the exhibition in the temporary exhibition space, part of our permanent setup in the Arsenaal is making room for the presentation of spectacular vehicles, planes and vessels, weapons and other objects involved in the liberation of Europe.

pickerTitle: Naturalis - LiveScience
name: LiveScience
metaDescription: With its big windows facing onto the street, this space acts as a shop window for Naturalis. This is where we show what we do as a research institute.
description: With its big windows facing onto the street, this space acts as a shop window for Naturalis. This is where we show what we do as a research institute. LiveScience’s permanent staging can accommodate 20 people.
descriptionReadMore:
### Impressive
In LiveScience you'll meet our researchers and collection managers, and you can see and experience what their work is all about. With such big windows, this ground floor space gets a lot of natural light. The staging is surrounded by our natural history collection. Huge display cases house the genetically engineered Herman the Bull, a giant sunfish, the wolf and gems from Dutch nature, to name but a few. A setting which is sure to make an impression.

pickerTitle: Zuiderzeemuseum - Fine birds make fine feathers
name: Fine birds make fine feathers
metaDescription: Fine feathers make fine birds! But a century ago the reverse: 'Fine birds (= the women) make fine feathers', was also very true.
description: Fine feathers make fine birds! But a century ago the reverse: 'Fine birds (= the women) make fine feathers', was also very true; in addition to their numerous other household chores, making, mending, repairing and washing (by hand!) the family wardrobe were among their responsibilities.
descriptionReadMore:
That's why girls learned right from childhood how to sew, embroider, knit, darn, let out and take in different garments. All of them techniques used rarely by women nowadays, but for which there seems to be a growing interest again. The result of all this needlework – meticulously made and maintained clothing that people made last a long way – was and still is a feast for the eye. 

### Maintaining clothing
Find out what kinds of things used to enter into making and maintaining clothing, admire the beautiful and sometimes touching final results and at the same time try your hand at giving your own clothes a longer life!

pickerTitle: Maritiem Museum Rotterdam - The Port
name: The Port
metaDescription: Dive into the story of the port at Rotterdam with the dozens of model ships in our collection!
description: Dive into the story of the port at Rotterdam with the dozens of model ships in our collection! Some of these unique models have not been on display for decades and they have been especially restored for this exhibition.
descriptionReadMore:
Rotterdam is the archetypical port city. Where better to dive into the story of this iconic place than the Maritime Museum, located at the very point where Europe’s biggest seaport once began? You can wander around for ages, discovering the moments that made the port a place where everything has been big, bigger and biggest!

### The collection is the star
Our collection, which covers six centuries of maritime history and which aficionados say is one of the world’s best, has the starring role in ‘The Port’. There are over seventy models of ships, cranes and dredgers for you to admire, as well as over a hundred paintings and photos. These objects give a wonderful picture of how the port of Rotterdam developed. How did the invention of the container change everything there? And what was the tragic fate of the first Dutch ocean steamer?

pickerTitle: Museon - National Geographic - Planet or Plastic
name: National Geographic - Planet or Plastic
metaDescription: Until spring 2021, National Geographic - Planet or Plastic is the theme of the National Geographic photo exhibition.
description: Until spring 2021, National Geographic - Planet or Plastic is the theme of the National Geographic photo exhibition. It shows a collection of journalistic photographs about the production of plastic, via its use until the stage of litter.
descriptionReadMore:
Artistic photographs will also be on display, drawing attention to the scale and sad effects of our use of plastic. The exhibition also shows photographs of scientific research of the plastic problem and the search for solutions to the pollution of the oceans.

### Impression
The images in the exhibition will make an unforgettable impression, inspire and encourage a more conscious handling of plastic waste. Come and see, for example, the pictures of the countless shops overloaded with plastic items, the golf surfer in the plastic soup or the picture of the tiny bit of plastic left over from two persons who live a zero-waste lifestyle. After two years they only had one jam jar full of uncleanable and compostable waste.

pickerTitle: Panorama Mesdag - CANDID
name: CANDID
metaDescription: Museum Panorama Mesdag presents a selection of photos of contemporary beach life from a non-commonplace perspective, in the exhibition CANDID.
description: Museum Panorama Mesdag presents a selection of over seventy photos of contemporary beach life from a non-commonplace perspective, in the exhibition CANDID.
descriptionReadMore:
The photos were commissioned by the museum from four up-and-coming photographers from The Hague that have started a collective on this occasion: Giedo van der Zwan (1967), Mirjam Rosa (1982), Merel Schoneveld (1983) and Sandra Uittenbogaart (1975). Together they created a portrait of contemporary beach life, that became nostalgic sooner than expected. The exhibition CANDID is on show until 28 February 2021 in The Hague.

### The CANDID collective
The diversity of the seaside resort is the common denominator of the collective. As a result, the photographers challenge and inspire each other. Ordinary people are captured in everyday situations against the backdrop of the familiar seaside resort, but they appear to be anything but ordinary. The artists do not stage-manage nor pass judgement; their photos are self-explanatory, honest, and authentic. In other words: they are CANDID.

pickerTitle: Rijksmuseum Muiderslot - Garden Safari
name: Garden Safari
metaDescription: Put on some old clothes and boots, and join us in a mission! The terrain around the castle is full of hidden treasures.
description: Put on some old clothes and boots, and join us in a mission! The terrain around the castle is full of hidden treasures. With a landing net, a jar for insects and a drawing sheet under your arm, you can investigate the gardens.
descriptionReadMore:
### Who can join?
A garden safari is suitable for children from 5 to 11 years old and is available every Wednesday between July 8 and August 26, 2020 at 1 p.m. Costs per child are 5 euros, excluding valid admission ticket. You can book your ticket at the cash desk of the castle.

Parents don’t have to join the garden safari, but if they really want to, they can join, if they keep at least 1,5 metres distance from the group.
entrance: [{'$type': 'Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain.Models.EntranceMuseumCardValidPlusAdditionalFee, Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain', 'museumCardHolderOnly': False, 'reservationIsNeeded': False, 'priceEntriesWithMuseumCard': [{'$type': 'Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain.Models.PriceEntry, Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain', 'name': 'Exclusief geldig entreebewijs, € 5', 'amountInEuros': 5.0, 'ageFrom': None, 'ageTo': None, 'description': 'Exclusief geldig entreebewijs'}], 'priceEntriesWithoutMuseumCard': [{'$type': 'Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain.Models.PriceEntry, Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain', 'name': 'Exclusief geldig entreebewijs, € 5', 'amountInEuros': 5.0, 'ageFrom': None, 'ageTo': None, 'description': 'Exclusief geldig entreebewijs'}], 'buyTicketUrl': None}]

pickerTitle: Rijksmuseum Boerhaave - Contagious!
name: Contagious!
metaDescription: Contagious! is a new exhibition on the outbreaks of contagious diseases and their ruinous effects on people’s lives.
description: Contagious! is a new exhibition on the outbreaks of contagious diseases and their ruinous effects on people’s lives. The exhibition also considers the outbreak of the new coronavirus and ties in with the national debate on vaccinations.
descriptionReadMore:
### Epidemics
This informative exhibition presents an intriguing balance between health and realistic risks and between social exclusion and compassion. How did people confront epidemics such as the plague and smallpox in the past? What insights do epidemics of the past have to offer for the future? What solutions does science have to offer?

pickerTitle: Space Expo - Mission at the museum
name: Mission at the museum
metaDescription: Dutch astronaut André Kuipers and author Sander Koenen take you on a special mission at the museum! You will study, train and work like a real astronaut.
description: Dutch astronaut André Kuipers and author Sander Koenen take you on a special mission at the museum! You will study, train and work like a real astronaut, will earn your own astronaut’s diploma and a unique Space Academy astronaut’s patch. Are you ready? Buckle up. 3… 2… 1…. Lift-off!
descriptionReadMore:
### What does the mission look like?
You will take a 60-minute, prearranged, safe COVID-19-proof tour of the museum, with plenty of time and space on the way to maintain a safe distance from other visitors. Leave earth behind you for a little while and enjoy everything about space and space travel. During this mission at the museum, people of all ages will discover what it means to be an astronaut. And of course, our younger visitors will have to help too!

**For children: astronaut's diploma and astronaut's patch.**

All our young visitors (children aged 4 to 12) buy a ticket including a mission toolkit. It contains assignments and experiments they can carry out during the Mission at the Museum. Afterwards, the children receive an astronaut’s diploma signed by André Kuipers and a unique Space Academy astronaut’s patch.
entrance: [{'$type': 'Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain.Models.EntranceMuseumCardValid, Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain', 'museumCardHolderOnly': False, 'isFreeWithMuseumTicket': False, 'reservationIsNeeded': True, 'priceEntriesWithoutMuseumCard': [{'$type': 'Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain.Models.PriceEntry, Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain', 'name': 'Mission toolkit, € 5', 'amountInEuros': 5.0, 'ageFrom': None, 'ageTo': None, 'description': 'Mission toolkit'}], 'buyTicketUrl': 'https://tickets.space-expo.nl/en/tickets'}]

pickerTitle: Afrika Museum - BITTER Chocolate Stories
name: BITTER Chocolate Stories
metaDescription: More than 2 million child labourers work on cocoa plantations in Ghana and the Ivory Coast. Who are these children and why do they work there?
description: More than 2 million child labourers work on cocoa plantations in Ghana and the Ivory Coast, and tens of thousands of children are victims of trafficking and forced labour in cocoa production. Who are these children and why do they work there?
descriptionReadMore:
### Stories from kids
Six of them tell their story in BITTER Chocolate Stories: Valerie, Mohamed, Catherine, Bassirou, Sarata and Issaka. Because of these children, we - the chocolate consumers thousands of miles away - can eat the chocolate that we enjoy so much.

### Co-operation
BITTER Chocolate Stories is a co-operation between photographer Joana Choumali, journalist Marijn Heemskerk, madame Bernadette Ouédraogo president of GRADE-FRB, Paradox and Tony’s Chocolonely.

pickerTitle: Philips Museum - Mission Eureka
name: Mission Eureka
metaDescription: Mission Eureka provides you with insights in Philips inventions, that remain secret for other visitors… It changes your visit to the Philips Museum.
description: Mission Eureka provides you with insights in Philips inventions, that remain secret for other visitors…
descriptionReadMore:
### Play Mission Eureka
Mission Eureka is an innovative group game about more than 100 years of Philips inventions for everyone aged 8 years and upwards. You play Mission Eureka with your friends, parents or grandpa and grandma in a team of 2, 3 or 4 persons. The game presents you with 8 different challenges you have to solve together. Touch a station in the Philips Museum with the iPad and a challenge starts. Together you’ll discover how LED light works or what X-ray does. It changes your visit to the Philips Museum.

pickerTitle: Airborne Museum at Hartenstein - Airborne Experience
name: Airborne Experience
metaDescription: Here you will feel the impact of the violence on the young boys who were desperately fighting for their lives.
description: The underground Airborne Experience showcases the war in all its intensity. Here you will feel the impact of the violence on the young boys who were desperately fighting for their lives.
descriptionReadMore: In the Airborne Experience you will follow in the footsteps of a British parachutist. You are briefed on the mission and board a glider. Through its windows you can see it takes off from England and flies to the occupied Netherlands.

pickerTitle: Zaans Museum - Verkade Experience
name: Verkade Experience
metaDescription: Right at the heart of the museum, you will find the Verkade Experience, a treat for young and old!
description: Right at the heart of the museum, you will find the Verkade Experience, a treat for young and old!
descriptionReadMore:
Here, you will be transported back to the chocolate and biscuit factory of the early twentieth century, where the original machines are still churning away and the history of Verkade comes alive.

### Serious Games
Have you always wanted to work in a chocolate and biscuit factory? Then take the chance now! Test your dexterity with the games at the Verkade Experience. Put on your work clothes and pretend to be a ‘Verkade girl’, a chocolate expert, or a biscuit baker. Will you get promoted to director, or will you be sacked?

### Your own chocolate wrapper
Get a chocolate bar of choice at the ticket desk of the Zaans Museum for €2,50 and create a custom Verkade chocolate bar wrapper using your own design and choice of colours. When you’re happy with your design, use the mini packaging machine to wrap your chocolate bar in your own wrapper.

pickerTitle: Zeeuws Museum - The Chambers of Wonder
name: The Chambers of Wonder
metaDescription: Admire the new displays in the Chambers of Wonder, situated in the museum’s attic.
description: A Chinese lidded vase measuring more than a meter in height, a series of guild medals and a mammoth tusk? Admire the new displays in the Chambers of Wonder, situated in the museum’s attic.
descriptionReadMore:
### Exceptional objects
The three cabinets contain more than a hundred exceptional objects collected by Zeelanders. Central to the displays is the relationship between art and science. For example, not only is the design of the Chinese vase fascinating, but so too is the technology of the porcelain production process. Consider how hard would it be to move such a large vase in and out of the kiln. The displays have been devised in collaboration with the artist Pepijn van den Nieuwendijk (Cirque de Pepin).

pickerTitle: Oorlogsmuseum Overloon - Museum in the dark
name: Museum in the dark
metaDescription: Want to visit the Overloon War Museum after closing time and after sunset? This is possible during "Museum in the dark".
description: Want to visit the Overloon War Museum after closing time and after sunset? This is possible during "Museum in the dark".
descriptionReadMore: Also in 2020 there will be six more evenings on the program in which visitors, through beautiful storytelling, special authentic images, video projections and lifelike re-enactment, are intrusively part of one or more storylines.
scheduledDates: [{'$type': 'Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain.Models.ScheduledDay, Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain', 'title': 'vrijdag 06 november', 'date': '2020-11-06T12:04:24.537+00:00', 'timePeriods': []}, {'$type': 'Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain.Models.ScheduledDay, Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain', 'title': 'zaterdag 07 november', 'date': '2020-11-07T12:04:39.902+00:00', 'timePeriods': []}, {'$type': 'Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain.Models.ScheduledDay, Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain', 'title': 'vrijdag 13 november', 'date': '2020-11-13T12:04:45.776+00:00', 'timePeriods': []}, {'$type': 'Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain.Models.ScheduledDay, Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain', 'title': 'zaterdag 14 november', 'date': '2020-11-14T12:04:55.351+00:00', 'timePeriods': []}, {'$type': 'Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain.Models.ScheduledDay, Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain', 'title': 'vrijdag 20 november', 'date': '2020-11-20T12:05:01.184+00:00', 'timePeriods': []}, {'$type': 'Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain.Models.ScheduledDay, Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain', 'title': 'zaterdag 21 november', 'date': '2020-11-21T12:05:13.238+00:00', 'timePeriods': []}]

pickerTitle: Hunebedcentrum - In Search of the Tomb Builders
name: In Search of the Tomb Builders
metaDescription: Take a journey through 150,000 years at the Hunebed Centre and come face to face with prehistory. Your journey through time begins in the Ice Ages.
description: Take a journey through 150,000 years at the Hunebed Centre and come face to face with prehistory. Your journey through time begins in the Ice Ages when the landscape was first shaped by wind and ice.
descriptionReadMore:
You will discover the first people who settled here centuries later and learn how they left their own mark on the landscape. See how our ancestors lived and worked here for thousands of years.

### Hunebed builders
Your visit to the Hunebed Centre begins inside the museum with the story of the hunebed builders. Hunebeds are ancient prehistoric tombs built over 5,000 years ago, which means that they are older than the Egyptian Pyramids and older than Stonehenge. They are called ‘hunebeds’ because in the past people thought that they were the beds of giants or ‘hunen’.

pickerTitle: Museum Helmond - Empress Maria of Brabant
name: Empress Maria of Brabant
metaDescription: The Empress Maria of Brabant exhibition is a tribute to the life of Maria of Brabant (1189-1260), lady of Helmond and a prominent citizen of the city.
description: The Empress Maria of Brabant exhibition is a tribute to the life of Maria of Brabant (1189-1260), lady of Helmond and a prominent citizen of the city. Maria serves as an example of a powerful woman who exercised extensive influence on the culture and history of her time.
descriptionReadMore:
Through new works of art and patterns, Christie van der Haak (born in The Hague in 1950) presents her own vision of this fascinating tale from the Middle Ages.

### Empress
Maria of Brabant lived in ‘t Oude Huys, the wooden predecessor of Helmond Castle. Maria became empress when she married the emperor of the Holy Roman Empire. She turned her castle into a centre of cultural and courtly life where poets and dignitaries would come to stay.

### Experience
A visit to this exhibition is an experience in itself, as you almost literally walk through and on the works of art. It presents a total experience that gives an entirely new and sometimes surprisingly unexpected interpretation of the story of Maria of Brabant.

pickerTitle: Natuurmuseum Fryslân - UnderWaterSafari
name: UnderWaterSafari
metaDescription: Go on safari and discover the Big Five of the underwater world of the Netherlands: the beaver, the otter, the catfish, the seal and the porpoise.
description: The UnderWaterSafari is an educational ride which you dive under the water level and still keep dry feet. Go on safari and discover the Big Five of the underwater world of the Netherlands: the beaver, the otter, the catfish, the seal and the porpoise.
descriptionReadMore:
Visitors make a journey from the sweet water of ditch and puddle to the salt water of the World Heritage the Wadden Sea. 

### Will you join us for a dive?
The UnderWaterSafari (for ages 4+) is a spectacular tour of the underwater world of the Netherlands. You can take a tour of the bottom of a ditch and lake and the Wadden Sea in a special vehicle. Drift along with the current and search for the Big Five: the seal, porpoise, catfish, otter and beaver.

pickerTitle: PreHistorisch Dorp - Discover it together with us
name: Discover it together with us
metaDescription: Don’t know where to start? Or do you want to learn even more? Then discover the preHistorisch Dorp together with us.
description: Don’t know where to start? Or do you want to learn even more? Then discover the preHistorisch Dorp together with us. Walk with our guide, or an audio guide, and let them tell you all about life in the various eras while visiting all the highlights.
descriptionReadMore:
### App
Would you like to learn more about what you see but at your own pace? Then follow our audio tour to nine locations in the village. Have a good look around and listen to all the extra information regarding your current location. Bring your own headset or purchase a pair at the ticket office for only € 1,-. [Download][1] the app.


  [1]: https://prehistorischdorp.nl/en/plan-your-visit/what-is-there-to-do

pickerTitle: Mariniersmuseum - FIRE! - Shooting game
name: FIRE! - Shooting game
metaDescription: For this game, your mission is to prevent a ship from being hijacked by pirates. How do you make sure the vessel is returned into safe hands?
description: For this game, your mission is to prevent a ship from being hijacked by pirates. How do you make sure the vessel is returned into safe hands?
descriptionReadMore:
### Stop the Pirates
Get a sense of what life on board of a navy ship is like in this true to life shooting game. You will be firing a real machine gun from the stern of a moving navy ship. Your job is to chase the pirates in their small boat away from the large vessel they are planning to seize. Super exciting, but make sure you do not actually hit the pirates themselves! Where Marines use force on people, they only do so as the very last resort to impose security. If you did hit a pirate, It’s game over!

The recommended age for this game is 8+.

pickerTitle: Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam - Beyond the Image - Bertien van Manen & Friends
name: Beyond the Image - Bertien van Manen & Friends
metaDescription: The Stedelijk pays tribute to Dutch photographer Bertien van Manen. This will be the first major survey of her oeuvre in the world.
description: The Stedelijk pays tribute to Dutch photographer Bertien van Manen an icon of contemporary photography. This will be the first major survey of her oeuvre in the world. In close liaison with Van Manen, in the exhibition each of her series will be combined with the work of another photographer.
descriptionReadMore:
### Visual diary
The work of Bertien van Manen (The Hague, 1942) is well represented in the Stedelijk collection. It is a highly autobiographical visual diary, in which she mirrors, examines and rediscovers her life in different ways, in those of others. Many of her series are long running projects for which she revisits places and people and develops close relationships with communities throughout the world.

pickerTitle: Het Noordbrabants Museum - Masterpieces from Vienna
name: Masterpieces from Vienna
metaDescription: The exhibition Masterpieces from Vienna shows an exceptional selection of 17th century paintings and drawings.
description: The exhibition Masterpieces from Vienna shows an exceptional selection of 17th century paintings and drawings taken from the as yet largely unknown collection of the Academy of Fine Arts Vienna.
descriptionReadMore:
The exhibition encompasses a large number of works by Flemish and Dutch masters, including Peter Paul Rubens, Anthony van Dyck, Jan Weenix and Rembrandt van Rijn. This is the first time that a selection of this magnitude will be exhibited in the Netherlands, and that the unique story of the Academy of Fine Arts Vienna and its valuable collection will be told.

### Educational role
Europe originally had numerous art academies, with collections of great prestige. These collections weren't so much assembled with the intention of being shown to the public, rather to enable students of art to study and copy the masterpieces within the walls of the academies. By the late 19th, early 20th century, ties with the art academies had largely been severed and most of the collections were absorbed by museums. However, the collection from the Academy of Fine Arts Vienna – whose history stretches back to 1692 – still belongs to the university and remains within the four walls of its monumental academy building in the Schillerplatz.

### Absolute masterpieces
The exhibition will run from 8 February until 1 June, showing over fifty paintings and twenty drawings. Absolute masterpieces are The Dreaming Silenus by Peter Paul Rubens, Self-Portrait as a Youth by Anthony van Dyck, Portrait of an Unknown Young Woman by Rembrandt van Rijn and The White Peacock by Jan Weenix.

pickerTitle: Museum de Fundatie - CRUX
name: CRUX
metaDescription: CRUX introduces the public to the work of four painters from Leipzig. Visit Museum de Fundatie.
description: CRUX introduces the public to the work of four painters from Leipzig: Martin Kobe (b. 1973), Mirjam Völker (b. 1977), Robert Seidel (b. 1983) and Titus Schade (b. 1984).
descriptionReadMore:
The artists’ paths crossed when they were students at the city’s renowned Academy, the Hochschule für Grafik und Buchkunst. Kobe was a Meisterschüler under Arno Rink; Völker, Seidel and Schade under Neo Rauch.

### Leipzig
As well as a city of books and music, Leipzig is a major centre for painting. Max Beckmann was born there and after World War II the city played a prominent part in the artistic life of the GDR, with Werner Tübke, Wolfgang Mattheuer and Bernhard Heisig as its chief representatives. Painting in East Germany was figurative, both by order of the state and due to the personal preferences of the artists. Abstraction and conceptualism, then so dominant in the art of the West, attracted little interest in the GDR. No wonder, therefore, that the art being created in Leipzig at that time was regarded as old-fashioned by contemporaries in the Netherlands and elsewhere in the Western world. Following the fall of the Berlin Wall, however, the work of Leipzig artist Neo Rauch (b. 1960) brought international appreciation. A member of the generation that followed Tübke, Mattheuer and Heisig, Rauch received his training in the GDR. Even though he was a true exponent of the Leipzig School, his large figurative works attracted worldwide notice in the 1990s. Major exhibitions followed, for example at New York’s Metropolitan Museum of Art. In the wake of Neo Rauch, a string of Leipzig painters gained an audience in the West and since then Leipzig has been regarded as a major nursery for painting talent.

pickerTitle: Kunsthal  Rotterdam - Black Album / White Cube
name: Black Album / White Cube
metaDescription: The worlds of visual art and pop music come together at the Kunsthal Rotterdam. Thirty five artists show works that have been influenced by music.
description: The worlds of visual art and pop music come together at the Kunsthal Rotterdam. From A$AP Rocky, Lady Gaga, and Britney Spears to Joy Division, Euromasters and The Beatles: this is the music that inspired the art in the exhibition ‘Black Album / White Cube’.
descriptionReadMore:
### Inspired
Thirty five internationally renowned artists show works that have been significantly influenced by music. Over two hundred contemporary artworks have been brought together in the exhibition, including photographs by Wolfgang Tillmans and Anton Corbijn, video installations by Cyprien Gaillard and Arthur Jafa, and paintings by Albert Oehlen and Emil Schult. Divided into chapters such as ‘remixing and sampling’ or ‘original and copy’, the exhibition features countless exciting cross-overs.

pickerTitle: Groninger Museum - Pronkjewails - Design from past and present
name: Pronkjewails - Design from past and present
metaDescription: Curator John Veldkamp decorated the Starck Pavilion with ceramic and glass objects. The exhibition illustrates the Groninger Museum’s collecting history.
description: For the museum building’s 25th anniversary, curator John Veldkamp decorates the Starck Pavilion with ceramic and glass objects from past eras and the present day. The exhibition illustrates the Groninger Museum’s collecting history.
descriptionReadMore:
### John Veldkamp
Veldkamp owned the renowned design store John John’s, which operated for more than 30 years on Oude Kijk in ’t Jatstraat in Groningen. In the 1980s, he encouraged the Groninger Museum’s then director, Frans Haks, to start collecting contemporary design.

pickerTitle: Museum MORE - Jan Mankes The unnameable
name: Jan Mankes The unnameable
metaDescription: In honor of Jan Mankes’ centenary, Museum MORE is displaying all Mankes paintings from our own collection in the Garden Room this spring and summer.
description: In honor of Jan Mankes’ centenary, Museum MORE is displaying all Mankes paintings from our own collection in the Garden Room this spring and summer, supplemented by beautiful loans. You can then admire about 35 masterpieces by “Holland’s most tranquil painter”.
descriptionReadMore:
### Jan Mankes
Dutch painter Jan Mankes (1889-1920) commanded a great deal of interest during his lifetime, and his popularity has only grown in the course of the last century.

His growing popularity is down to the relatability of his oeuvre, but also his ‘language of feelings’. The sensibility with which Mankes touched the essence of small and everyday themes is characterised by the same modesty for which he strived as a human being. “Art is manifesting spiritual life,” wrote Mankes in 1913 to his patron Aloysius Pauwels, a cigar merchant. And: “Given that pure spiritual element, the unnameable, cannot be named, one has to rely on the means of material things.” As a consequence of such comments and what was written about him following his death, Mankes is viewed as an artist whose mind tried to read the soul of things, thereby placing them in a different reality.

pickerTitle: Fries Museum - Frisians
name: Frisians
metaDescription: Tough, resilient and self-assured: all qualities generally attributed to Frisians. It’s a cliché of course, or is there some truth to it?
description: Tough, resilient and self-assured: all qualities generally attributed to Frisians. It’s a cliché of course, or is there some truth to it? When can you actually call yourself a Frisian?
descriptionReadMore:
The exhibition shows how Frisian identity has been viewed over the centuries. Classic portraits show the Frisian elite and give a face to dignitaries and celebrities. Artists also began portraying ordinary people from the beginning of the 20th century.

### Landscapes
Through the centuries, countless artists have documented the Frisian landscape. The meadows, lakes and ever-present winds have an unmistakable effect on the inhabitants of this region.

What do these portraits tell us about the Frisians? Is Friesland really so unique, or is it first and foremost a part of the Netherlands, Europe and the world?

pickerTitle: Centraal Museum - The Tears of Eros
name: The Tears of Eros
metaDescription: These were themes that fascinated the Utrecht surrealist artist Moesman. Surrealism is generally seen as a male art movement.
description: Sex, fetishism and taboos. These were themes that fascinated the Utrecht surrealist artist Moesman. Surrealism is generally seen as a male art movement. Some of the best-known names are Dali, Magritte and Ernst. But there were female surrealist artists as well.
descriptionReadMore:
### Sexual fantasies
When Moesman discovered surrealism towards the end of the 1920, he was hooked immediately. He took it as an opportunity to indulge his sexual fantasies on the canvas – with the excuse that the images were produced by the subconscious, for which he couldn’t be held responsible.

Moesman’s women seldom show a personal identity. Their faces are usually turned away from the viewer, or they are masked, or their faces are replaced by things like a keyhole or sea anemone.

pickerTitle: Museum Beelden aan Zee - Jacob van der Beugel - A Mutating Story
name: Jacob van der Beugel - A Mutating Story
metaDescription: In his monumental sculptures, the Dutch artist Jacob van der Beugel (1978) presents human cells as a ‘biological landscape’.
description: Humans are complex beings made up of trillions of cells, each with their own structure and function. In his monumental sculptures, the Dutch artist Jacob van der Beugel (1978) presents human cells as a ‘biological landscape’.
descriptionReadMore:
### Art and science
These evocative works show the vulnerability of human cells, but also their ability to mutate, change and adapt. He brings together a sense of the inevitable and a sense of hope through compelling, beautiful works that merge art with science through the unique use of ceramics and new, cutting-edge building materials such as ‘self-healing’ concrete. For Van der Beugel these works are a metaphor for an exploration of the human genome (genetic material) and its capacity to mutate. He invites viewers to question and consider their biological futures and the process of human degeneration; the wasting away of cells.

pickerTitle: Museum Catharijneconvent - Miracles all around us
name: Miracles all around us
metaDescription: Miracles are of every age, every culture and every religion. They have played a part in everyday life since the beginning time.
description: Miracles are of every age, every culture and every religion. They have played a part in everyday life since the beginning time, and have been inspiring artists for centuries.
descriptionReadMore:
### Power of imagination
Depicting what takes place between heaven and earth makes the greatest demands on their powers of imagination. That challenge has given birth to the most stimulating and moving art. From Rembrandt to Mondrian and Abramovich, the museum has brought together a selection of the most beautiful and astonishing works from national and international collections.

pickerTitle: Museum Volkenkunde - A sea of islands - Masterpieces from Oceania
name: A sea of islands - Masterpieces from Oceania
metaDescription: This exhibition focuses on the islanders’ connection with the water and their huge resourcefulness.
description: Made up of thousands of islands in the Pacific Ocean, Oceania covers more than a third of the Earth’s surface, extending from New Guinea to Easter Island, and from New Zealand to Hawaii. The ocean borders the islands, but it has also always been the thing that connects them.
descriptionReadMore:
This exhibition focuses on the islanders’ connection with the water and their huge resourcefulness. It features objects of breathtaking beauty, from canoes several metres long and ingenious navigation tools to statues and jewellery.

### Contemporary art
It also includes contemporary art, with eye-catching pieces like the live-action video by Lisa Reihana and an installation by George Nuku.

pickerTitle: Museum MORE | Kasteel Ruurlo - Carel Willink
name: Carel Willink
metaDescription: Stately, enigmatic, elegant and the world at a distance, Carel Willink (1900-1983) is the cool grandmaster of neo-realism.
description: Stately, enigmatic, elegant and the world at a distance, Carel Willink (1900-1983) is the cool grandmaster of neo-realism. From the age of thirty his reputation grew as an unparalleled painter of monumental, architectural sets and ominous skies.
descriptionReadMore:
### Masterpieces
The arrangement in Kasteel Ruurlo shows the development of a searching artist, who later develops into the unrivaled painter of a technically perfect, elegant and enigmatic body of work. The collection in the castle is rotating, but there are always masterpieces by the master painter.

pickerTitle: De Pont museum - The route is being recalculated
name: The route is being recalculated
metaDescription: In the collection being installed at De Pont Museum, thirty years of collecting is viewed from the vantage point of the turbulent times in which we live.
description: In the large presentation of the collection being installed at De Pont Museum this summer, thirty years of collecting is viewed from the vantage point of the turbulent times in which we now live.
descriptionReadMore:
### Grow with times
Art has the capacity to grow with the times and keeps on inviting new interpretations. In The Route is Being Recalculated – a playful reference to words spoken by a navigation system when a wrong turn is taken – the collection is thus considered on the basis of a moment when so much that was taken for granted has been shaken up. We’re still in the middle of a pandemic, struggling with the consequences of our history with slavery, are being faced with abuse of power in the #MeToo scandal, and groups not heard are raising their voices.

pickerTitle: Frans Hals Museum Hof - Image power
name: Image power
metaDescription: ‘Image Power’ brings together works of twenty international contemporary artists that question the role of art in an image saturated world.
description: ‘Image Power’ brings together works of twenty international contemporary artists that question the role of art in an image saturated world.
descriptionReadMore:
The Frans Hals Museum proudly presents the exhibition trilogy ‘The Art of Critique’. This series of exhibitions reflects on Institutional Critique, an art movement that surfaced in the late 1960’s and again in the 1990’s.

Practices labelled as Institutional Critique take the institutions that make up the art world (museums, galleries, art fairs) as the topics of their art.

### Exhibition trilogy
‘Image Power’, the first chapter of the exhibition trilogy, is a group exhibition featuring twenty international artists whose work questions the role of art in our image driven age of social media and political unrest.

pickerTitle: Fotomuseum Den Haag - Helena van der Kraan BEER & TEDDY
name: Helena van der Kraan BEER & TEDDY
metaDescription: Helena van der Kraan has photographed over two hundred teddy bears over the past few years, portraying them in the same way she portrays people.
description: Many of us had a teddy bear as kids. A friend you took with you everywhere. You probably even gave it a name, like Bear or Teddy, making the relationship even more personal.
descriptionReadMore:
So it is no surprise that in psychology a teddy bear is regarded as an important transition object, supporting the child as it explores the world. 

### Two hundred teddy bears
Helena van der Kraan (1940-2020) has photographed over two hundred teddy bears over the past few years, portraying them in the same way she portrays people. The bears in her pictures sometimes appear proud and self-assured, sometimes fearful and melancholy, but they are always dignified. Around a hundred photographic portraits of teddies will be on display at The Hague Museum of Photography.

pickerTitle: Dordrechts Museum - Slow Fashion - Dordrechts Museum
name: Slow Fashion - Dordrechts Museum
metaDescription: For the first time in fifty years, the Dordrechts Museum will be putting its extensive fashion collection on exhibition.
description: For the first time in fifty years, the Dordrechts Museum will be putting its extensive fashion collection on exhibition. They will showcase 50 masterpieces that trace the most important silhouettes of 150 years of fashion.
descriptionReadMore:
### From fast fashion to slow fashion
Fast fashion is today’s norm. In the past, an item of clothing would be used for years, whereas nowadays fashions change several times a season. In the old days, if a garment went out of fashion it would be kept or used for something new. The Slow Fashion exhibition, which is being staged at two locations, shows how carefully our ancestors treated their clothes – thoughtfully and sustainably. Historical items of clothing therefore form ideal conversation pieces to kickstart the discussion about sustainable fashion. Slow Fashion reveals how surprisingly up-to-date historical fashion can be.

### Dordrechts Museum: Renewable Fashion
The Dordrechts Museum has a fine collection that spans six centuries of Dutch painting, including work by great artists such as Aelbert Cuyp, Jacob Maris, Jan Sluijters and Marlene Dumas. With Slow Fashion the Dordrechts Museum presents two halls filled with ladies’ fashions from the 18th to the 20th centuries, together with paintings, prints, photographs and accessories. Alongside the historical items, there are also modern designs by Ronald van der Kemp, Monique Collignon, Monique van Heist, Anouk Beckers, Heleen Klopper and Rianne de Witte, all of whom pay particular attention to sustainability and recycling.

pickerTitle: Hortus Botanicus Leiden - From Columbus to Mayflower
name: From Columbus to Mayflower
metaDescription: Hortus Botanicus focusses on the American plants that were known in our regions at that time.
description: In 2020 many parties in Leiden will pay attention to the fact that a ship called Mayflower left for America 400 years ago. Hortus Botanicus focusses on the American plants that were known in our regions at that time.
descriptionReadMore:
### Famous botanists
The most famous botanists from the second half of the sixteenth century were Carolus Clusius, Rembert Dodoens and Mathias Lobelius. This "Botanical Renaissance" also included the establishment of university botanical gardens, such as Hortus botanicus Leiden (1590). The Hortus was already 30 years old when the first group of Pilgrims exchanged Leiden for the New World. There is no evidence of it, but they have undoubtedly have walked in our freely accessible garden.

pickerTitle: Joods Historisch Museum - Charlotte Salomon in close-up
name: Charlotte Salomon in close-up
metaDescription: Until November 22, 2020, the Jewish Historical Museum will be transformed temporarily into a cinema from the 1920s and ’30s.
description: Until November 22, 2020, the Jewish Historical Museum will be transformed temporarily into a cinema from the 1920s and ’30s. The exhibition Charlotte Salomon in close-up explores the influence of film on Charlotte Salomon’s gesamtkunstwerk Life? or Theatre? A Singspiel.
descriptionReadMore:
### Hundreds of gouache drawings
Charlotte Salomon (1917- 1943) was born into a Jewish family in Berlin, where she studied art. She created her ‘multi-media’ masterpiece, which comprises hundreds of gouache drawings, in the South of France after fleeing Nazi Germany. She was arrested in 1943 and deported to Auschwitz, where she was murdered soon after her arrival. Her parents found Life? or Theatre? in the South of France in 1947. It was later published and adapted for cinema and has since become world famous, delighting and moving generations of readers ever since.

pickerTitle: Design Museum Den Bosch - The Poster is Dead
name: The Poster is Dead
metaDescription: Everywhere we look, adverts vie for our attention. But where posters were once static, our eyes are now drawn increasingly to moving pictures.
description: We’re surrounded by images: everywhere we look, adverts vie for our attention. But where posters were once static, our eyes are now drawn increasingly to moving pictures. Traditional graphic design on paper is gradually giving way to ‘motion design’ on screens.
descriptionReadMore:
### Motion design
The title of the exhibition is obviously tongue-in-cheek: beautifully designed posters are still being produced. All the same, moving images on screens have now firmly established themselves in our everyday lives. From railway stations and motorways to shops and bus shelters, wherever you go, you’ll find a flickering screen running brief and colourful full-motion videos that try to grab your attention. For advertisers, motion design offers the additional benefit that a moving image can get a commercial message across in just a few seconds.

pickerTitle: Amsterdam Museum - Beer - Amsterdam, City of Beer and Brewers
name: Beer - Amsterdam, City of Beer and Brewers
metaDescription: In our new exhibition Beer - Amsterdam, City of Beer and Brewers you'll learn all about the long journey Amsterdam's beer travelled through history.
description: In our new exhibition *Beer - Amsterdam, City of Beer and Brewers* you'll learn all about the long journey Amsterdam's beer travelled through history to end up in your glass.
descriptionReadMore:
### Amsterdam, city of beer and brewers
Amsterdam beer city. It has been since the 14th century when the city, together with Medemblik, was designated as the only import port for beer from Germany. Later, the current world market leader Heineken was established here. And nowadays, Amsterdam has over 45 breweries, with which the city has the largest number of brewers in the Netherlands by far.

### Backwards through beer history
In the exhibition the visitor is led from the present to the past. You start in the recent craft beer revolution of small breweries and proceed via the advance of lager in the late 19th century to the beginning of Amsterdam as a staple market for German hopping beer in the 14th century.

### Tastes differ
There are about 400 different types of beer worldwide. Depending on the ingredients, the taste varies from sour to salty and from bitter to sweet, but they are all made according to the same process. In the exhibition you will discover the different flavours and raw materials, but you will also learn more about, for example, the role that hops play in shelf life.

### Busy brewers
It goes without saying that the exhibition gives a lot of attention to contemporary Amsterdam brewers. For example, De Prael functions as a social workshop and Troost converts residual waste into bread or electricity. Get acquainted with the city's many brewers.

### Beer Conscious
Beer was the number one popular drink for centuries. Because the water was not clean and the wine was too expensive everyone drank it, even children. But now, more than in the past, the production and consumption of beer are being called into question. That is why the exhibition also pays attention to the ecological footprint of breweries, the macho image beer had for a long time, and the social and health effects of alcohol consumption.

pickerTitle: Eye Filmmuseum - Chantal Akerman Passages
name: Chantal Akerman Passages
metaDescription: Eye Filmmuseum is presenting a solo exhibition of work by Chantal Akerman. Akerman was one of the first film directors who made the switch to visual art.
description: This summer, Eye Filmmuseum is presenting a major solo exhibition of work by Chantal Akerman. Akerman was one of the first film directors who made the switch to visual art. She rose to fame in the 1970s as a feminist avant-garde filmmaker, midway through the 1990s, she discovered the art gallery.
descriptionReadMore:
In 1995 she created a large spatial installation on 24 monitors based on D’Est, a film she originally made as a documentary. This marked the start of her ‘second career’ within the world of visual art.

### Film installations
The exhibition features eight of Akerman’s film installations. In addition to D’Est, they include a.o. Woman Sitting after a Killing (2001), Tombée de nuit sur Shanghai (2007-2008) and her final work NOW (2015).

pickerTitle: Museum Prinsenhof Delft - Silver, Masterpieces of Delft silver 1590-1800
name: Silver, Masterpieces of Delft silver 1590-1800
metaDescription: For the first time in 50 years, the Museum Prinsenhof Delft is presenting an overview of the most beautiful silver objects produced in Delft.
description: In the early 17th century, Delft silver was among the finest in the Low Countries. For the first time in 50 years, the Museum Prinsenhof Delft is presenting an overview of the most beautiful silver objects produced in Delft.
descriptionReadMore:
A total of 80 masterpieces from the period when the art of Delft silversmiths flourished will be on display: showpieces like nautilus cups, drinking bowls and unique table ornaments from the 17th century, as well as showpieces for tea and dining ceremonies, and precious 18th century toilet services. 

### Exceptional pieces
Highlights from the museum’s own leading collection of silver will be supplemented with exceptional pieces on loan from both foreign and Dutch collections. Immerse yourself in a unique spectacle of silver, discover why the art of silver was often more highly valued in the 17th century than the art of painting and how silver has been connecting generations with each other for decades.

pickerTitle: Nederlands Fotomuseum - The Collection Illuminated by Marwan Magroun
name: The Collection Illuminated by Marwan Magroun
metaDescription: Magroun’s personal pick of images from the museum’s rich and varied collection expresses his fascination with the city of Rotterdam and its population.
description: The next in the series of exhibitions entitled The Collection Illuminated by ... is guest-curated by Rotterdam photographer Marwan Magroun. Magroun’s personal pick of images from the museum’s rich and varied collection expresses his fascination with the city of Rotterdam and its population.
descriptionReadMore:
### Demolished housing and low-skilled work
The selection includes photos by Ton den Haan, Robert de Hartogh, Carel van Hees and Peter Martens. Their pictures show the hardships of life in Rotterdam in the 1970s and 80s: a world of demolished housing and low-skilled work. Immigrant children play in the street in ragged clothing. Young Surinamese toughs hang out on the Kruiskade or the Schouwburgplein.

### Child of immigrants
Himself the child of immigrants, Magroun sees his own past reflected in these images. He says his selection shows the continuous rapid changes occurring in immigration and diversity.

pickerTitle: Museum Het Rembrandthuis - HERE. Black in Rembrandt’s Time
name: HERE. Black in Rembrandt’s Time
metaDescription: Black people were present in the Netherlands in the seventeenth century. Here, in society, in Rembrandt’s neighbourhood and in art.
description: Black people were present in the Netherlands in the seventeenth century. Here, in society, in Rembrandt’s neighbourhood and in art. It is an aspect that has long been overlooked.
descriptionReadMore: This exhibition brings you eye to eye with portraits of black people. How did artists depict them? And can we find out who they are? HERE: Black in Rembrandt’s Time is about overlooked works of art and representation, about recognition and acknowledgment.

pickerTitle: Louwman Museum - Model cars
name: Model cars
metaDescription: As soon as motor cars started to appear on the roads, so did toy cars. You can admire lots of model cars in the Louwman Museum.
description: As soon as motor cars started to appear on the roads, so did toy cars. The engineering of the real thing inspired toymakers to create miniature masterpieces of their own.  Spindizzies, introduced in the 1930s, raced on special tracks at speeds of up to 200 km/h.

pickerTitle: Kranenburgh - Air
name: Air
metaDescription: Air: it seems so ordinary. But given some thought, it is a fascinating phenomenon. Visit this exhibition in Museum Kranenburgh.
description: Air: it seems so ordinary. But given some thought, it is a fascinating phenomenon. For this exhibition, guest curator Colin Huizing invited internationally acclaimed artists who question and make tangible the wonder of air.
descriptionReadMore: They allow you to experience the beauty and essence of air, or draw attention, directly or indirectly, to the imperilled state of the air in the atmosphere. In doing so, they heighten our awareness of the world in which we live. Especially now, where breathing in clean air can no longer be taken for granted.

pickerTitle: Bonnefanten - Beating around the bush #6: Scenes from the Anthropocene
name: Beating around the bush #6: Scenes from the Anthropocene
metaDescription: The exhibition Beating around the bush #6: Scenes from the Anthropocene presents artworks that can be associated with certain aspects of the Anthropocene.
description: Since 2014, the Bonnefanten has been presenting its collection in an explorative way in the exhibition programme Beating around the bush. In different episodes, both the fixed values and the ‘quiet reserve’ of the collection are brought into dialogue with new and proposed acquisitions.
descriptionReadMore:
### The Anthropocene
The exhibition Beating around the bush #6: Scenes from the Anthropocene presents artworks that can be associated with certain aspects of the Anthropocene. They provide starting points for critical reflection on the unprecedented possibilities that humans have created for themselves, as expressed in achievements in the areas of science, art and welfare, which we count as our civilisation. 

### The drawbacks
On the other hand, there is a focus on the drawbacks of the Anthropocene, such as the escalating faith in manipulability or the downside to our ever-increasing footprint.

pickerTitle: Stedelijk Museum Alkmaar - Collection Paul Rijkens
name: Collection Paul Rijkens
metaDescription: Stedelijk Museum Alkmaar will be showing the Paul Rijkens Collection. Rijkens was one of the most influential Dutchmen of the twentieth century.
description: Stedelijk Museum Alkmaar will be showing works from the Paul Rijkens Collection. Rijkens was one of the most influential Dutchmen of the twentieth century.
descriptionReadMore: A visionary captain of industry, for decades he moved in the circles of the world’s power brokers, and he was also an art lover and a collector of contemporary art. The exhibition features a surprising and colourful selection of works from his collection by Jan Sluijters, Matthieu Wiegman, Gustave De Smet, Constant Permeke and other important Belgian and Dutch artists of the first half of the twentieth century. Our thanks go to the lenders and to the Rijkens family.

pickerTitle: TextielMuseum - Common threads | Old and new stories in art and design
name: Common threads | Old and new stories in art and design
metaDescription: This exhibition centres on storytelling in a way that brings art and design together. Presenting personal and cultural perspectives.
description: Stories take many forms, but a good story affects you. This exhibition centres on storytelling in a way that brings art and design together. Presenting personal and cultural perspectives, the exhibition shows that our world is made up of multiple stories.
descriptionReadMore:
Few things are as human as telling stories. By sharing stories, we can discover what other people experience, what they consider important and what makes us the same as well as different. The exhibition ‘Common threads | Old and new stories in art and design’ explores how artists and designers shape narratives and ideas.

### Perspectives
Personal perspectives are the common thread that runs through this exhibition, which features works from the museum’s collection organised around themes such as religion and spirituality, gender and sexuality, and children’s stories and fantasies. Alongside contemporary pieces, the exhibition presents works covering a period of around 200 years – from myths and biblical stories to modern, personal tales.

What is your story? Discover the common threads in this colourful exhibition.

With works by: Eylem Aladogan, Mercedes Azpilicueta, Christiaan Bastiaans, Walter van Beirendonck, Célio Braga, Studio Formafantasma, Jaime Hayon, Hella Jongerius, Susanne Khalil Yusef, Kustaa Saksi, Jennifer Tee, Anna Verwey-Verschuure, Roy Villevoye and others.

pickerTitle: Van Abbemuseum - Victor Sonna. 1525
name: Victor Sonna. 1525
metaDescription: This exhibition is featuring one hundred and fifty two unique pieces of art. Check it out at the van Abbemuseum in Eindhoven.
description: The first solo exhibition of Eindhoven-based artist Victor Sonna will open at the Van Abbemuseum on 18th July 2020. The exhibition is entitled 1525.
descriptionReadMore:
In 2015 in New Orleans, Victor purchased the chains of an enslaved person. The number 152 was engraved on the chains. This purchase marked the start of a personal journey of 
discovery through Ghana and Suriname, among others. 

### Unique pieces of art
The result is an exhibition featuring one hundred and fifty two unique pieces of art - the series 152 - six films and fifty two prints in which Victor treats the subject of slavery in his own unique way. The exhibition title is a play on the number 152. A single five is added: one of the first transatlantic transports of enslaved people took place in 1525.

pickerTitle: Limburgs Museum - Aad de Haas - Forbidden Art
name: Aad de Haas - Forbidden Art
metaDescription: His work was banned, banished, and led to his imprisonment. Check out the work of painter and graphic artist Aad de Haas.
description: His work was banned, banished, and led to his imprisonment. Painter and graphic artist Aad de Haas defied the rules imposed on him by the church and society. Figurative and expressionist, religious and pornographic: whatever the subject of his works, they were all exceptionally artistic.
descriptionReadMore:
### Harsh
In the later years, the intense expression of his attitudes and ideas broke the mould. Many of his works were about the balance of power between him and the church, or between man and woman. They represent the human deficit in a harsh, often ruthless society.

### Afraid to show
In the exhibition Aad de Haas – Verboden Kunst (Forbidden Art)*, we will show you what no one has been allowed to see so far, including sketches that even Aad de Haas was afraid to show: ‘If they discover these drawings, they'll cut my head off. No doubt about it.’ The exhibition can be seen in the Limburgs Museum from 1 June 2020 to 14 March 2021 inclusive.

*Please note: this exhibition may contain shocking images.

pickerTitle: Nationaal Reddingmuseum Dorus Rijkers - Museumschepen
name: Museumschepen
metaDescription: Het Nationaal Reddingmuseum Dorus Rijkers heeft, naast een prachtige collectie in het museum, ook een mooie collectie reddingboten buiten het museum.
description: Het Nationaal Reddingmuseum Dorus Rijkers heeft, naast een prachtige collectie in het museum, ook een mooie collectie reddingboten buiten het museum. Voor het museum aan de steiger liggen 6 historische reddingboten, waaronder het museumpronkstuk: de reddingboot Insulinde uit 1927.
descriptionReadMore:
### Van dichtbij bekijken
De reddingboten kun je vanaf de kade bezichtigen en er zijn regelmatig rondleidingen, waar vrijwilligers met veel passie over de boten vertellen. Vraag de baliemedewerkers naar de mogelijkheden. Er staat een reddingboot van de klasse Valentijn naast het museum die je met een verhoogd platform van dichtbij kunt bezichtigen. 

### Geschiedenis van de reddingboot
In het museum is een aantal reddingboten tentoongesteld, die de ontwikkeling in tijd goed weergeven. Van roeireddingsloepen uit de tijd van Dorus Rijkers tot de pijlsnelle RIB’s die de KNRM nu gebruikt.

pickerTitle: Continium discovery center - Extra: 3D-film
name: Extra: 3D-film
metaDescription: Combineer je museumbezoek aan Continium met een 3D-film in Columbus earth center voor een compleet dagje uit.
description: Ga mee op reis naar de ruimte: Combineer je bezoek aan Continium met een spectaculaire 3D film!
descriptionReadMore:
### Fly Me To The Moon
In 1969 reisden de astronauten Armstrong, Aldrin en Collins naar een plek waar tot dan toe nog niemand was geweest: de maan. Fly me to the Moon neemt je mee terug naar dat historische moment. Maar de astronauten zijn niet alleen…

De drie jonge vliegjes, de ondernemende Nat, de slimme IQ en de grappige Scooter maken hun droom waar door stiekem mee te vliegen met die eerste reis naar de maan. Ze komen voor veel spannende uitdagingen te staan die de reis in gevaar brengen. Zouden ze de missie kunnen redden?

*Dagelijks om 11:15, adviesleeftijd 10+*


### Journey to Space 3D
Menselijke missies naar Mars zijn straks geen science fiction meer. Ontdek hoe NASA de weg heeft vrijgemaakt om steeds dieper de ruimte in te gaan, naar asteroïden, Mars en verder. Leer meer over de belangrijke rol van het Internationale Ruimtestation ISS en krijg inzicht in de uitdagingen die NASA en de ruimtevaartindustrie moeten aangaan om gewaagde toekomstige missies tot een succes te brengen.

Uitgebreide interviews met astronaut Chris Ferguson (commandant van de laatste shuttle-missie) en toekomstig astronaut Serena Aunon, gecombineerd met een inspirerende vertelling, maken Journey To Space tot een geweldig overzicht van de ruimtevaartprestaties in het verleden, huidige missies en de imposante toekomstplannen.

*Dagelijks om 14:00 uur, alle leeftijden*

pickerTitle: Continium discovery center - Science Show Astronautentraining
name: Science Show Astronautentraining
metaDescription: Science show in het museum: ben jij Spaceproof? Ontdek het in de Astronautentraining!
description: Ben jij Spaceproof? Ontdek het tijdens de Science Show Astronautentraining in het theater van Continium. Tijdens deze spannende Science Show ga je je verbazen over de meest bijzondere experimenten.
descriptionReadMore:
### Ruimtevaarder in opleiding
Samen met de Continium explainer ga je als ruimtevaarder in opleiding testen hoe spaceproof je bent. Ben je sportief? Hoe is je hand-oog coördinatie? Welke uitrusting heb je nodig? Waarom moet je een ruimtevaartpak aan? Spreek je je talen? Wat wordt er gegeten in de ruimte? En hoe gaan ze naar de wc? Samen werken jullie toe naar de lancering van de raket. Inclusief aftellen, in het Russisch uiteraard!

### Onderdeel van wetenschap en techniek
Verbazen, ontdekken, lachen en zelf een handje meehelpen: welkom bij de Science Show! Je wordt zelf onderdeel van wetenschap en techniek. Met leuke experimenten wordt op een grappige manier een link gelegd tussen het dagelijks leven en wetenschappelijke weetjes. Soms ben je toeschouwer, een andere keer speel de de hoofdrol! Bij sommige experimenten is er namelijk hulp nodig van een vrijwilliger uit de zaal. De Science Show is leuk voor jong en oud!
extraVisitInformation: {'$type': 'Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain.Models.EventExtraInformation, Museumvereniging.Persistent.Domain', 'text': 'De Science show Astronautentraining is weer dagelijks te zien deze zomervakantie. De show is inbegrepen in je Continiumticket. De show wordt meerdere keren per dag geprogrammeerd. Let op, er zijn een paar spelregels vanwege de coronamaatregelen én we hebben minder zitplaatsen per show beschikbaar. Ben er dus op tijd bij!', 'link': 'https://www.continium.nl/nl/activiteiten/science-show'}
